org.goobi.production.model.bibliography.course

Class Course

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.ArrayList<Block>
          • org.goobi.production.model.bibliography.course.Course
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<Block>, Collection<Block>, List<Block>, RandomAccess

    public class Course
extends ArrayList<Block>
    The class Course represents the course of appearance of a newspaper.

    A course of appearance consists of one or more blocks of time. Interruptions in the course of appearance can be modeled by subsequent blocks.

    Author:
    Matthias Ronge <matthias.ronge@zeutschel.de>
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      The function guessTotalNumberOfPages() calculates a guessed number of pages for a course of appearance of a newspaper, presuming each issue having 40 pages and Sunday issues having six times that size because most people buy the Sunday issue most often and therefore advertisers buy the most space on that day.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Course

        public Course()
        Default constructor, creates an empty course. Must be made explicit since we offer other constructors, too.

      • Course

        public Course(Document xml)
       throws NoSuchElementException
        Constructor to create a course from an xml source.
        Parameters:
        xml - XML document data structure
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if ELEMENT_COURSE or ELEMENT_PROCESSES cannot be found
        IllegalArgumentException - if the dates of two blocks do overlap
        NullPointerException - if a mandatory element is absent

      • clearProcesses

        public void clearProcesses()
        The procedure clearProcesses() deletes the process list. This is necessary if the processes must be regenerated because the data structure they will be derived from has changed, or if they only had been added temporarily to be able to retrieve an XML file containing values.

      • countIndividualIssues

        public long countIndividualIssues()
        The method countIndividualIssues() determines how many stampings of issues physically appeared without generating a list of IndividualIssue objects.
        Returns:
        the count of issues

      • getIndividualIssues

        public LinkedHashSet<IndividualIssue> getIndividualIssues()
        The function getIndividualIssues() generates a list of IndividualIssue objects, each of them representing a stamping of one physically appeared issue.
        Returns:
        a LinkedHashSet of IndividualIssue objects, each of them representing one physically appeared issue

      • getFirstAppearance

        public org.joda.time.LocalDate getFirstAppearance()
        The function getFirstAppearance() returns the date the regularity of this course of appearance starts with.
        Returns:
        the date of first appearance

      • getLastAppearance

        public org.joda.time.LocalDate getLastAppearance()
        The function getLastAppearance() returns the date the regularity of this course of appearance ends with.
        Returns:
        the date of last appearance

      • getNumberOfProcesses

        public int getNumberOfProcesses()
        The function getNumberOfProcesses() returns the number of processes into which the course of appearance will be split.
        Returns:
        the number of processes

      • guessTotalNumberOfPages

        public long guessTotalNumberOfPages()
        The function guessTotalNumberOfPages() calculates a guessed number of pages for a course of appearance of a newspaper, presuming each issue having 40 pages and Sunday issues having six times that size because most people buy the Sunday issue most often and therefore advertisers buy the most space on that day.
        Returns:
        a guessed total number of pages for the full course of appearance

      • getProcesses

        public List<List<IndividualIssue>> getProcesses()
        The function getProcesses() returns the processes to create from the course of appearance.
        Returns:
        the processes

      • isMatch

        public Block isMatch(org.joda.time.LocalDate date)
        The function isMatch() iterates over the array of blocks and returns the first one that matches a given date. Since there shouldnâ€™t be overlapping blocks, there should be at most one block for which this is true. If no matching block is found, it will return null.
        Parameters:
        date - a LocalDate to examine
        Returns:
        the block on which this date is represented, if any

      • recalculateRegularityOfIssues

        public void recalculateRegularityOfIssues()
        The method recalculateRegularityOfIssues() recalculates for all blocks of this Course for each Issue the daysOfWeek of its regular appearance within the interval of time of the block. This is especially sensible to detect the underlying regularity after lots of issues whose existence is known have been added one by one as additions to the underlying issue(s).

      • remove

        public Block remove(int index)
        The function remove() removes the element at the specified position in this list. Shifts any subsequent elements to the left (subtracts one from their indices). Additionally, any references to the object held in the map used for resolving are being removed so that the object can be garbage-collected.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface List<Block>
        Overrides:
        remove in class ArrayList<Block>
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the element to be removed
        Returns:
        the element that was removed from the list
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= size())
        See Also:
        ArrayList.remove(int)

      • splitInto

        public void splitInto(Granularity mode)
        The method splitInto() calculates the processes depending on the given BreakMode.
        Parameters:
        mode - how the course shall be broken into issues

      • toXML

        public Document toXML()
        The function toXML() transforms a course of appearance to XML.
        Returns:
        XML as String
